pullRequest.bodyText:
Have you signed the contributor license agreement?

If submitting code, is your pull request against master? Unless there is a good reason otherwise, we prefer pull requests against master and will backport as needed.
If submitting code, have you checked that your submission is for an OS and architecture that we support?

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            In order to create a distribution, simply run the `./gradlew assemble` command in the cloned directory.
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            The distribution for each project will be created under the `build/distributions` directory in that project.
          
          
            
            The distribution will be created under the `distribution/build/outputs` directory in the cloned directory root.
          
          
            
            To build distributions from your local Elasticsearch repo, run:
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            ./gradlew assemble
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            To build the distribution for a specific platform, run the related command:
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            ./gradlew :distribution:archives:linux-tar:assemble
          
          
            
            ./gradlew :distribution:archives:darwin-tar:assemble
          
          
            
            ./gradlew :distribution:archives:windows-zip:assemble
          
          
            
            ----
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
            Finished distributions are output to `distributions/archives`.

 In order to create a distribution, simply run the `./gradlew assemble` command in the cloned directory.

nodes.bodyText: FWIW, you can now run ./gradlew localDistro which will build the appropriate distribution for the current platform. The task also prints the output location for you so you don't have to guess about searching for it. We should probably mention it here as it's the preferred way to locally build Elasticsearch and get up and running quickly.
